intro: Neoachmandra backeri subsp. balinensis, commonly known as the Balinese neoachmandra, is a rare flowering plant native to the Indonesian island of Bali. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, grass-like stems and small, clustered inflorescences. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories and wetlands. Due to habitat loss, it is considered vulnerable and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
